qas.question: Who believes there are innumerable other Buddhas in other universes?
What buddhist belief says that Buddhas come one at a time and not within other eras?

context: In addition, <a0_0>Mahayana Buddhists<a0_0/> believe there are innumerable other Buddhas in other universes. A <a1_0>Theravada<a1_0/> commentary says that Buddhas arise one at a time in this world element, and not at all in others. The understandings of this matter reflect widely differing interpretations of basic terms, such as "world realm", between the various schools of Buddhism.
